meanings.definition: A person or thing that causes embarrassment or humiliation.
meanings.sent1: The mortifier of the situation was the unexpected arrival of her ex-boyfriend.
meanings.sent2: The class clown can sometimes be a mortifier with his jokes.
meanings.sent3: The mortifier of the party was when the cake fell on the host's lap.
meanings.sent4: Her loud laughter became the mortifier of the otherwise quiet library.
meanings.sent5: The mortifier of the play was the actor who forgot his lines on stage.

meanings.definition: A substance used to preserve or embalm a dead body.
meanings.sent1: The mortifier used by the embalmer kept the body preserved for the funeral.
meanings.sent2: The ancient Egyptians used special mortifiers in their mummification process.
meanings.sent3: The mortifier spilled on the floor, causing a strong smell in the room.
meanings.sent4: The mortifier seeped into the skin of the deceased, ensuring long-lasting preservation.
meanings.sent5: The mortifier's scent filled the embalming room, overpowering all other smells.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel embarrassed or humiliated.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally mortified her friend by revealing a secret in front of others.
meanings.sent2: Public speaking can sometimes mortify even the most confident individuals.
meanings.sent3: He mortified himself by tripping over his own feet in front of his crush.
meanings.sent4: The embarrassing video went viral, mortifying the person in it.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's scolding in front of the class mortified the student.
